SEARCH
Package org.domain.classes

Class Shelf

java.lang.Object
org.domain.classes.Shelf
public class Shelf extends Object
A class representing a shelf for storing products with a defined capacity. The shelf can be configured with an algorithm for distributing products.

  • Constructor Details

    • Shelf

      public Shelf(int id, int xsize, int ysize, ProductList productList, AbstractAlgorithm abstractAlgorithm)
      Constructs a Shelf object with the specified parameters.

      This constructor initializes a shelf with the provided ID, x and y size, product list, and the algorithm to be used for the shelf's operations. It also initializes the distribution history as an empty list.

      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier for the shelf.
      xsize - the horizontal size (capacity) of the shelf.
      ysize - the vertical size (capacity) of the shelf.
      productList - the list of products assigned to the shelf.
      abstractAlgorithm - the algorithm used to manage the shelf's operations.

  • Method Details

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Gets the unique identifier of the shelf.

      This method returns the ID of the shelf, which uniquely identifies it within the system.

      Returns:
      the unique ID of the shelf.

    • getMaxCapacity

      public int getMaxCapacity()
      Gets the maximum capacity of the shelf.

      This method calculates the maximum capacity of the shelf by multiplying its x and y dimensions (size). The result represents the total number of items the shelf can hold.

      Returns:
      the maximum capacity of the shelf, calculated as xsize * ysize.

    • getNumProducts

      public int getNumProducts()
      Gets the total number of products on the shelf.

      This method returns the total quantity of products currently assigned to the shelf, by retrieving the quantity from the associated product list.

      Returns:
      the total quantity of products on the shelf.

    • getAbstractAlgorithm

      public AbstractAlgorithm getAbstractAlgorithm()
      Gets the algorithm used by the shelf.

      This method returns the abstract algorithm associated with the shelf, which defines the operations or logic for managing the shelf's distribution and organization.

      Returns:
      the abstract algorithm used by the shelf.

    • getAlgorithmName

      public String getAlgorithmName()
      Retrieves the name of the algorithm from the abstract algorithm.

      This method delegates the call to the AbstractAlgorithm.getName() method and returns the name of the algorithm. It assumes that the abstractAlgorithm object is properly initialized and contains the name of the algorithm.

      Returns:
      The name of the algorithm as provided by the AbstractAlgorithm.

    • getListName

      public String getListName()
      Retrieves the name of the product list associated with this object.

      This method accesses the productList object and returns its name. The name typically represents the identifier or description of the product list.

      Returns:
      The name of the product list.

    • changeAlgorithm

      public void changeAlgorithm(AbstractAlgorithm abstractAlgorithm)
      Changes the algorithm used by the shelf.

      This method updates the algorithm associated with the shelf, allowing the shelf to use a different strategy or logic for its operations.

      Parameters:
      abstractAlgorithm - the new algorithm to be used by the shelf.

    • distribute

      public Distribution distribute(String name, int limit)
      This method updates the distribution array to reflect the new product arrangement. Distributes the products on the shelf using the current algorithm. The distribution is stored in the distribution history.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the distribution.
      limit - The limit for the algorithm (number of combinations if is Brute Force or maximum neighbours visited if is Hill Climbing).
      Returns:
      The Distribution object ordered by the algorithm.

    • getNameLastDistribution

      public String getNameLastDistribution() throws ShelfException
      Gets the name of the last distribution applied to the shelf.

      This method retrieves the name of the most recent distribution from the distribution history. If no distributions have been applied, it throws a ShelfException.

      Returns:
      the name of the last distribution.
      Throws:
      ShelfException - if no distributions exist for the shelf.

    • getLastDistribution

      public Distribution getLastDistribution() throws ShelfException
      Gets the last distribution applied to the shelf.

      This method retrieves the most recent Distribution object from the distribution history. If no distributions have been applied, it throws a ShelfException.

      Returns:
      the last Distribution object applied to the shelf.
      Throws:
      ShelfException - if there are no distributions for the shelf.

    • makeCurrentDistribution

      public void makeCurrentDistribution(Distribution dist) throws DistributionException
      Updates the distribution history to mark the specified distribution as the current one.

      This method checks if the given distribution exists in the history. If it exists, the distribution is removed from its current position and re-added to the end of the list, effectively marking it as the "most recent" or "current" distribution.

      Parameters:
      dist - the Distribution object to be marked as current.
      Throws:
      DistributionException - if the specified distribution does not exist in the history.

    • getProductList

      public ProductList getProductList()
      Gets the product list associated with the shelf.

      This method returns the ProductList that is currently assigned to the shelf, containing the products available on the shelf.

      Returns:
      the product list of the shelf.

    • changeProductList

      public void changeProductList(ProductList productList)
      Changes the product list assigned to the shelf.

      This method updates the shelf's product list and resets the distribution history, effectively starting a fresh distribution history for the new product list.

      Parameters:
      productList - the new ProductList to be assigned to the shelf.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the shelf.

      This method creates a string representation of the shelf, including its ID, size dimensions (xSize and ySize), and the details of the associated product list.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the shelf, including its ID, dimensions, and product list.

    • toStringLastDistribution

      public String toStringLastDistribution()
      Returns a string representation of the shelf with its last distribution.

      This method creates a string representation of the shelf, including its ID, size dimensions (xSize and ySize), and details of the most recent distribution applied to the shelf. If no distributions have been applied, it may throw a ShelfException.

      Returns:
      a string representation of the shelf and its last distribution.

    • getDistributionLog

      public Set<TupleType> getDistributionLog()
      Retrieves a set of distribution log entries, each represented as a TupleType. The log entries contain the name, last modification date, and creation date for each Distribution in the distribution history.
      Returns:
      a Set of TupleType objects, where each tuple represents the name, last modification date, and creation date of a distribution.

    • getDistribution

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<String>> getDistribution(String distName) throws DistributionException
      Retrieves the distribution of products for a given distribution name. The distribution is returned as a nested list of strings, where each string represents the name of a product. The structure mirrors the original distribution matrix, with each row containing the names of the products in that row.
      Parameters:
      distName - the name of the distribution to retrieve.
      Returns:
      a nested list of strings representing the product names in the specified distribution.
      Throws:
      DistributionException - if the distribution with the specified name is not found.

    • getDistributionNames

      public Set<String> getDistributionNames() throws DistributionException
      Retrieves the names of all distributions in the system.

      This method iterates through the distribution history and collects the names of all distributions into a Set. If the distribution history is empty, it throws a DistributionException with an appropriate error message.

      Returns:
      A Set of strings containing the names of all distributions.
      Throws:
      DistributionException - If there are no distributions in the system.
